result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Atty Pollak makes comment on no longer being able to represent the Defendant due to conflict. Currently looking for a new attorney to represent her. 
Court makes a status conference to determine if she has received an attorney by that time.

3:19 PM Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Mindi Lynn Wilber.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State request court to take Judical  Notice of Bond in Sawyer County Case 21CF357.  Attny Pollak no objection.  Court takes judicial notice.   State calls witness, City of Hayward, Officer Ryan Krummel, Sworn in by court.  State begins examination.  3:22 PM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  
3:29 PM Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.   Attny Pollak no further questions. 3:33 PM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State makes argument, request for bind over.  Attny Pollak request dismissal at this time and makes argument.   State continues argument.  Attny Pollak continues argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.     Attny Pollak puts court on notice bond modification to be filed.
Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
09:05 AM Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appear by video.  Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Counts 3 and 4.   Attny Pollak makes bond argument, regarding treatment.    Appearing by zoom, Phyllis Billyboy, Mother of DEF, Court has discussion with Mother.   State no comment.   DEF makes statement.  Discussion takes place regarding preliminary hearing.  DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Court amends bond.     EFFECTIVE  MARCH 2, 2022   Cash bond to be converted to SIBS $25,000 ~  DEF to be released from jail at 6:00 AM to be transported by Mother Phyllis Billyboy to treatment in Rhinelander, Wisconsin.  When DEF has completed treatment, DEF must return to Sawyer County Jail.  CASH BOND of $25,000 is to be reinstated when DEF returns to Sawyer County Jail.  Bail Bond Hearing to set when DEF returns to Jail.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.
